Documentation Index
Package babel

Package babel

Integrated collection of utilities that assist in internationalizing and localizing applications.

This package is basically composed of two major parts:

  • tools to build and work with gettext message catalogs
  • a Python interface to the CLDR (Common Locale Data Repository), providing access to various locale display names, localized number and date formatting, etc.
See Also:
http://www.gnu.org/software/gettext/, http://docs.python.org/lib/module-gettext.html, http://www.unicode.org/cldr/

Version: 1.0dev-r482

Submodules
  • babel.core: Core locale representation and locale data access.
  • babel.dates: Locale dependent formatting and parsing of dates and times.
  • babel.localedata: Low-level locale data access.
  • babel.messages: Support for gettext message catalogs.
    • babel.messages.catalog: Data structures for message catalogs.
    • babel.messages.checkers: Various routines that help with validation of translations.
    • babel.messages.extract: Basic infrastructure for extracting localizable messages from source files.
    • babel.messages.frontend: Frontends for the message extraction functionality.
    • babel.messages.jslexer: A simple JavaScript 1.5 lexer which is used for the JavaScript extractor.
    • babel.messages.mofile: Writing of files in the gettext MO (machine object) format.
    • babel.messages.plurals: Plural form definitions.
    • babel.messages.pofile: Reading and writing of files in the gettext PO (portable object) format.
  • babel.numbers: Locale dependent formatting and parsing of numeric data.
  • babel.support: Several classes and functions that help with integrating and using Babel in applications.
  • babel.util: Various utility classes and functions.

Variables
  __package__ = 'babel'
